title: Solvesall d.o.o.

author: Luka Stopar, Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: Hello everybody, my name is Lucas Topper.
I'm very happy to be here and to be able to present our company.
Solves all.
We are also a very young company.
We were founded two years ago and we're quite an ambitious team team of six people.
We have two PHD's, 2 Masters and one designer.
And we primarily deal with mobility services, AI, machine learning and software and hardware development.
Currently we're developing software for motorhomes and caravans.
But also for mobile houses and for buses.
We collaborate tightly with the AI laboratory at Jozef Stefan Institute, where we get a lot of this AI and machine learning knowledge.
We also originate from this Department, so we were in this.
In this mobility and logistics group.
These are our current customers.
Our largest customer is Adrian Mobile which is a motorhome and caravan manufacturer through Adrian Mobile.
We have access to about 8% of the EU caravan market and motorhome market with the potential of up to 40% via their parent company.
We also work with other home which builds mobile houses.
And with LP there we developed the API that provides this bus arrival data so the bus data that you see on the bus stations on Ljubljana that comes from us.
And also quite a few apps have now have now come based on this.
And we also work with media Bus who we also provide with.
With buzz data.
Our main product is called Mark.
It's a remote control solution for motorhomes.
Now I won't go into details here.
I think it's better if I just showed the movie.
So this is our app.
I'll explain it a bit more later.
OK, so that was Mark.
Now, some of the more AI features that it has.
It's building a heat map of locations in real time, so when we detect that multiple vehicles stop at the same location, we store that location.
And when we see that the some vehicles fill up water, then we assume that the location has some equipment where you can fill the water in and we store that into our database.
We also suggest locations based on resource consumption, so if we see that the user is running low on water we can suggest where he can go to fill up.
And we do resource prediction.
We're also adapting Mark to mobile houses.
Here we are adding features to monitor the state of the House and to monitor the state of the neighborhood of houses.
So that will be able to detect maybe some humidity or some leakage or this kind of things.
This is the hardware of.
This slide is pretty technical and it has a lot of interfaces to connect to the vehicle.
What's interesting about this hardware is that it has Wi-Fi module and an LTE module, so you can insert a SIM card and you can use it to access the Internet.
It also has security and encryption, so there's no danger of anyone eavesdropping, and it does over the air updates.
This is our first screen.
The user can select to connect to the vehicle via our cloud or they can connect locally via Bluetooth or Wi-Fi.
We have our own database of.
Interesting locations or locations of interest.

Oh, here we primarily deal with locations that are interested for motorhome users and for vacationers, so these are campsites, parking places, rest sites, but also service places where they can repair their vehicle.
We use a free level interface of remote control.
So on the first level here we have an overview of the status of the vehicle and then the user can go into more levels of detail.
And in the end, then they can see what was happening with their device up to a month into history.
We control all of the appliances in the motorhome that includes the AC in the refrigerator, the heater and these kind of things.
Here we have some example graph.
So here we see what was happening with the battery or the living room battery for a few weeks back.
Here we see the daily fluctuations in the carbon dioxide, so we can see that when people were in the motorhome, it really tends to jump up.
There we have the gas bottle and here we see how the heater was configured overtime.
Weed.
Resource predictions, so here we have an example of predicting when the car battery is going to run out and the living room battery.
So here we do the expected time, right?
But we also do.
This is a range, right?
So minimum to maximum.
Now, aside from water, we also predict the gas consumption and the clean and wastewater consumption.
And.
Thank you very much.
